questions.question_text: Which of the following documents would MOST likely provide a broad, non-customized overview of a product or service?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
An RFI provides a broad, non-customized overview of a product or service because it is designed to collect general information about potential solutions rather than detailed, specific information. An RFI can be used to gather information about a wide range of products or services, which makes it a good choice when the organization is looking to explore its options and identify potential vendors or suppliers.

questions.question_text: Which of the following documents will MOST likely result in a time and material agreement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. RFB. Request for Bid (RFB) is a formal request for proposals from potential vendors or contractors to provide a product or service at a specified price. In a time and material (T&M) agreement, the vendor or contractor is paid based on the actual time and materials spent on the project, rather than a fixed price. RFBs are often used in T&M agreements because they allow the vendor or contractor to submit a proposal based on their estimated time and materials for the project.
